title: Baby girl accidentally shot in Petaluma home, police say
content:
An 11-month-old girl was injured Saturday when a firearm inside a Petaluma home accidentally discharged, police said.
It wasn’t immediately clear how the gun went off, but investigators believe it was an accident and don’t intend to make any arrests, said Lt. Tara Salizzoni of the Petaluma Police Department.
Police and paramedics were called to the residence — described only as being in the east side of the city — at 6:13 p.m. The girl, suffering from a gunshot wound, was transported to Santa Rosa Memorial Hospital and then flown to Children’s Hospital in Oakland, Salizzoni said.
Salizzoni said she did not know the child’s condition Sunday. Police said in a statement Saturday, “The best information investigators have at this time is that the child is expected to survive.”
Kimberly Veklerov is a San Francisco Chronicle staff writer. Email: kveklerov@sfchronicle.com Twitter: @kveklerov
